Pre-Game Insights: Bafana Bafana will test themselves against former African champions, Algeria in a FIFA Series match on Tuesday night.
South Africa is still in high spirits after finishing third at the recent CAF African Cup of Nations tournament in Ivory Coast.
Under the management of Hugo Broos, Bafana will bank on their fine run and will look to cause an upset against the highly-rated Algerian side.
Fresh from a 1-all draw against Andorra last week, Bafana will look to score goals at Nelson Mandela Stadium in Algiers.

The Algerians come into this game on the back of a come-from-behind 3-2 triumph over Bolivia last week, with goals from Amine Gouiri, Yassine Benzia, and Mandi giving new coach Vladimir Petkovic a winning start to his reign.
Bafana Bafana coach Hugo Broos will be forced to bring back the likes of Themba Zwane against Algeria.
The Desert Foxes boast top football stars such as Aissa Mandi, Nabil Bentaleb, Yacine Brahimi, and Said Benrahma among others.
The hosts will be without Ismael Bennacer due to injury, while Ramy Bensebaini is doubtful for the clash and Riyad Mahrez was left out of the squad at his request.
Themba Zwane, Ronwen Williams, and Siyanda Xulu are all set to return to the starting eleven for Bafana.
Coach Broos is wary of the Algerians but believes they are a beatable opponent.
Themba Zwane will be key for Bafana to ensure they rotate the ball and cause problems for the hosts.
Yacine Brahimi will be tasked with opening up the defence of Bafana with his silky touches and brilliant movement off the ball.
Algeria and South Africa have met in four matches dating back to January 1996, with each team claiming one win and two games drawn.
Their most recent meeting was in the group stage of the 2015 Africa Cup of Nations, with Algeria claiming a 3-1 win.
Hugo Broos, the former AFCON winner with Cameroon, will look to guide Bafana to a win just before the upcoming 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers against Nigeria and Zimbabwe.
Vladimir Petkovic, the newly appointed coach of Algeria, will want to start his tenure on a high and bag a win over the South Africans.
